column4: Is there a shortcut to uninstall all the games that are installed by default on Dapper?
I doubt that
Maybe changing the Icon="blah" line in /usr/share/applications Gvim7 ?
btw, I checked what you asked, and it's ok. (the Icon in gvim.desktop is set correctly)
You got a weird keyboard or something?
I would first try reconfiguring xorg with the proper keyboard specs.
Does this problem happen on any keyboard? or just that one?
What did you do just before this problem starting ocurring?
played around with gconftool-2
disabled some KB shortcuts.
And what were you chaning in gconf?
Can you return those to what they were?
I'm not sure how. Basically, Alt-Shift stopped working
Sounds like you disabled it in gconf
might have, any idea how to reinstitute it?
Did you do this via a terminal?
yes
open a terminal and run the 'history' command to see what you did, then you can reverse it.
thanks, I'll try this next.
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop
thanks
